catalog_info.title: Intermediate Macroeconomics: Advanced
catalog_info.notes: Economics 1011b fulfills the intermediate macroeconomic theory requirement for Economics concentrators. Students may take either Economics 1010b or Economics 1011b for credit. This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Empirical and Mathematical Reasoning.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Economics 1011a or 1010a and Mathematics 21a, or permission of the instructor.
catalog_info.description: The same topics as in 1010b, but with a more mathematical approach. Prerequisites for this class include Economics 1011a or 1010a and Mathematics 21a, or permission of the instructor.
